metadata.title: CVE-2016-6866 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - low
metadata.description:
slock allows attackers to bypass the screen lock via vectors involving aninvalid password hash, which triggers a NULL pointer dereference and crash.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2016-6866` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

suckless-tools - 42-1
No subscription required

criterions.comment: suckless-tools package in bionic, is related to the CVE in some way and has been fixed (note: '42-1').
